items.text: pushes through the covers
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: picks the googly as he keeps to his crease and defends it smoothly
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: leans into a drive and finds long-off
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: googly again, Mithun plays for the legbreak, looking for a run through long-on. Instead, he gets one off the outside edge to long-off
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: pulls his length back and Mushfiqur, quite comfortably, flicks to square leg
items.postText: Naren: "I think Kedar may not bowl today, no need to breakup partnerships. Bangladesh is giving away themselves."
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Sunil Swain: "Another MSD masterstroke! That's Dhoni's wicket as much as it is Jadeja's. He may not have been amongst runs but his sheer presence inspires the entire team especially in crunch situations. And his presence behind the stumps has helped Chahal and Yadav a lot!"
items.text: brings him forward as he angles a good length ball into the pads, looking for lbw. Mithun's bat intervenes just in time
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: pushes it through on middle, Mithun stays back and nudges it to the leg side
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: invites the big shot with loads and loads of flight but Mithun's drive doesn't work with Jadeja getting the ball to dip sharply
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: dabs towards point
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: reverse sweep! And it's excellently done too. The pressure was building on Mithun. He couldn't beat the infield in front of square. Then he remembered that Jadeja bowls very quickly and that third man is up
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.text: defends a very quick delivery on off stump, and even as Jadeja goes to his left to field it, he belts out a big lbw appeal, hoping it hit pad first. And he's right. Replays show it was a good shout and HawkEye confirms it would have been out had India reviewed!
items.postText: Nitin: ""Wish the personal/political rivalries get buried by this beautiful game of cricket. My mind wishes for an India-Pakistan finale while the heart says that the Afghanistan team deserves to triumph - Good luck to all!!!""
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: gets it to drift outside off, Mushfiqur reaches the pitch and smothers the turn
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: brings out the sweep again - he seems to go for the shot the moment Kuldeep puts some flight on it - and gets a single to deep square leg
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.text: good length, outside off, going on with the angle from round the wicket. Mushfiqur tries a late cut and misses
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: turns it around to square leg
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: that's a googly, Mushfiqur plays it from the crease, using his wrists to keep the ball down. Single through square leg
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: lunges forward to drive to mid-off. That's drinks
items.postText:
PeruCricket: "Back with my Peruvian organic coffee pondering, how did things change to the point where Jadeja is a better test player than an odi player? #HighAltitudeMeditations" --- Well, he was ranked the No. 1 long format bowler and it's largely because of his accuracy, and those close-in fielders that prevent batsmen from getting long strides so he can get lbw

Ibrahim: "Bangladesh always plays with at least one or two players whose presence in the team defies common sense. We call them "Lord quota". If there is only one player playing in the Lord quota, team can still fight it's way out. But when 3-4 players are in the team are from the quota, the team falls apart."
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: gets forward to block on off stump
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: turn as Mushfiqur presses forward down the line to play the angle and then has to push his bat away from his body to make contact with the ball
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: picks the short ball very very quickly, rocking back to cut to point's right. Pandey's there, keeping it to a single
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: huge appeal for lbw and umpire Raza gives it. Mithun reviews immediately though. This is the typical Jadeja delivery - attacking middle stump, and quickly at that. Replays - the slow motion kind and they're highly necessary to make this decision - suggest the ball hits pad first and then goes on to bat. Mithun has a long stride forward but it won't do him any good. Jadeja skids these balls through and very rarely does height matter in his lbw appeals.
items.postText: Sumon: "Selectors must be pulling their hair out. Shoumya, Sabbir, Imrul, Anamul, Liton, Shanto all of them were the logical picks for the national team. But they all let the selectors down. BD is playing with effectively half a batting lineup for 2-3 years now."
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, OUT

dismissal.text: Mohammad Mithun lbw b Jadeja 9 (19b 1x4 0x6) SR: 47.36

items.text: a little turn again and Jadeja has his hands in his head as he watches Mahmudullah not moving his feet and playing away from his body
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mahmudullah, no run

items.text: full on middle and off, he gets the feet working better now and looks much better in defence
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mahmudullah, no run

items.text: gets the legbreak to drift into Mushfiqur - and sharply - to beat the inside edge and hit the pad
items.shortText: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: hits all across the line and Dhoni believes he's got Mushfiqur stumped. The batsman goes for the sweep, playing against the turn, but this time he's left lunging for the ball, and in the process has pulled his back leg out of the crease. The third umpire is brought into play and he's got a wicked decision to make. Mushfiqur does take the effort to push his back heel into safety, but replays aren't conclusive whether it is on the line or behind it when Dhoni breaks the stumps. This will be hard and Marais Erasmus has gone by the book - benefit of the doubt to the batsman
items.shortText: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run
